Package it.polimi.ingsw.messages.actions

Class StartProduction

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.messages.actions.StartProduction
All Implemented Interfaces:
Action, Message, java.io.Serializable
public class StartProduction
extends java.lang.Object
implements Action
Class StartProduction is an Action. It's created and sent to the server when the player wants to start the production.
See Also:
Serialized Form

  • Constructor Details

    • StartProduction

      public StartProduction​(java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> chosenCards, java.util.List<ResourcePosition> inputRes, java.util.List<ResourcePosition> outputRes, java.util.List<LeaderEffect> leaderEffects)
      Default constructor. Creates a new StartProduction instance.
      Parameters:
      chosenCards - the development slots the player wants to activate
      inputRes - the resources to pay to start the production
      outputRes - the resources generated from the production
      leaderEffects - the list of leader effects that can modify the action

    • StartProduction

      public StartProduction​(java.util.List<ResourcePosition> inputRes, java.util.List<ResourcePosition> outputRes, java.util.List<LeaderEffect> leaderEffects)
      Reduced constructor. Used in unit tests to test the board production.
      Parameters:
      inputRes - the resources to pay to start the production
      outputRes - the resources generated from the production
      leaderEffects - the list of leader effects that can modify the action

    • getType

      public UserAction getType()
      Description copied from interface: Action
      Returns the type of the action performed by the player.
      Specified by:
      getType in interface Action
      Returns:
      the type of the action

    • doAction

      public boolean doAction​(Player player)
      Expends the resources to activate the production and stores the generated resource in his chest. If the players obtains faithpoint it increments his position on the itinerary.
      Specified by:
      doAction in interface Action
      Parameters:
      player - the player performing the action
      Returns:
      true

    • devCardsConstructor

      private void devCardsConstructor​(Player player) throws WrongActionException
      Constructs the list of played development cards from the selected development space.
      Parameters:
      player - the player performing the action
      Throws:
      WrongActionException - if one of the development slot is not valid, is empty or is selected twice

    • checkAction

      public void checkAction​(Player player) throws WrongActionException
      Checks if the action can be performed and resolves the leader effects.
      Specified by:
      checkAction in interface Action
      Parameters:
      player - the player who wants to perform the action
      Throws:
      WrongActionException - if the action cannot be performed

    • addOutputRes

      public void addOutputRes​(ResourcePosition extra)
      Adds a ResourcePosition object to the list of output resources. Used by the ProductionEffect.
      Parameters:
      extra - the resource produced by the production effect

    • addInputRes

      public void addInputRes​(ResourcePosition extra)
      Adds a ResourcePosition object to the list of input resources. Used by the ProductionEffect.
      Parameters:
      extra - the resource required by the production effect

    • checkInputOutput

      private void checkInputOutput​(java.util.List<DevCard> devCards) throws WrongActionException
      Checks if the input and output lists provided when creating this StartProduction object correspond to the input and output resources of the development cards and board production.
      Parameters:
      devCards - the development cards actived
      Throws:
      WrongActionException - when one of the check fails

    • totalDevCardResources

      private void totalDevCardResources​(java.util.List<ResourceQuantity> totalDev, java.util.List<ResourceQuantity> production)
      Modifies the first list, adding the resources contained in the second list.
      Parameters:
      totalDev - the list to modify
      production - the source list
